thread.title: Girls' tennis: Lancaster players advance to District Three semifinals
thread.title_full: Girls' tennis: Lancaster players advance to District Three semifinals

author: STAFF REPORT | SPORTS@LNPNEWS.COM
title: Girls' tennis: Lancaster players advance to District Three semifinals
text:
Girls' tennis: Lancaster players advance to District Three semifinals STAFF REPORT | SPORTS@LNPNEWS.COM Comments 
As the District Three girls’ tennis singles tournament got underway Saturday in Hershey, the Class AA bracket in particular had a local flavor. 
Of the eight players in the bottom half of the draw, five — including the two surviving semifinalists — were from Lancaster and Lebanon schools. 
At noon Monday, play will resume at the Hershey Racquet Club, and Pequea Valley’s Lenea Riehl will face second-seeded Maja Andersson of Northern Lebanon for the right to advance to the Class AA championship match later that afternoon. 
And in Class AAA, the last Lancaster-Lebanon League player standing, fourth-seeded Taylor Capoferri of Lampeter-Strasburg, will face No. 1 Sammi Snyder of Exeter in the semifinals. 
Capoferri made it into the semis on a 4-6, 6-4, 7-5 first-round win over Northeastern’s Laura Zielinski and a 6-1, 6-4 victory over Hershey’s Heidi Luise Wingert. Snyder, meanwhile, knocked out Hempfield freshman Amanda Hagino 6-4, 7-5 to make the semis. 
Also in Class AAA, Manheim Township’s Kate Moore made it to the quarterfinals on a 6-3, 6-3 win over McCaskey’s Sophie Rathmell, but ultimately fell to No. 3 seed Yvonne Peters-Washington of Central York, 6-3, 4-6, 6-1. Peters-Washington knocked out Township’s Julia Darkey 6-4, 6-4 in Saturday’s opening round. 
In Class AA play, Riehl’s Saturday included a 6-2, 6-0 win over Lancaster Country Day’s Amy Shields in the first round, and a 6-2, 6-0 quarterfinal ousting of Shields’ Cougars teammate — and No. 3 seed — Grace Zechman. 
Zechman had made the quarters on a 6-1, 6-4 win over Rachel Martin of James Buchanan. 
Meanwhile, Andersson opened on a 6-3, 6-1 win over Melanie Haas of Hamburg before dropping Elco’s Sydney Nye 6-1, 6-1 in the quarters. More Headlines
